intro: Iriartea pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf puya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms and cycads. The plant is characterized by its compact size, typically growing no taller than 30 centimeters, and its striking, spiky inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and clustered at the base, forming a rosette shape. Iriartea pygmaea is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
